Title: Koncert Viktor Kalabis - Klasický nonet
Description:
NeoKlasik orchestr
Viktor Kalabis - Klasický nonet
30. 11. 2022
Galerie Ludvíka Kuby Poděbrady

Klasický nonet (1956) je dílo Viktora Kalabise (1923-2006), zakladatele Nadace Bohuslava Martinů, který svou badatelskou činností významně přispěl k rozšíření povědomí o životě a díle tohoto klasika české moderní hudby. Kalabisova žena, Zuzana Růžičková pak byla vynikající cembalistkou, jejíž interpretace Martinů Koncertu pro cembalo dílu zajistila čestné místo ve světovém repertoáru pro tento exkluzivní nástroj.

Interpreti:

NeoKlasik orchestr
Václav Dlask /dirigent/

Technické zajištění: Acusticus s.r.o.
Dramaturgický úvod: Sára Jandová
Produkce: Kryštof Tulis, Anežka Januszová, Adéla Rybářová

Title: The 52nd PAN Music Festival "Sideshow" (2009-2015) for amplified octet and electronic playback
Description:
The 52nd PAN Music Festival
2024년 11월 7일 목 19:30 성암아트홀
ensemble mosaik Berlin 
"Sideshow" (2009-2015) for amplified octet and electronic playback in five movements by Steven Kazuo Takasugi

20세기 초 코니아일랜드 놀이공원의 어두운 사이드쇼를 바탕으로 한 이 작품은 기교, 괴물 쇼, 엔터테인먼트, 스펙터클, 비즈니스, 그리고 세상에서 살아남기 위해 치르는 희생에 대한 명상이다. 비엔나 풍자가 카를 크라우스(1874-1936)의 여섯 가지 격언이 작품 전체를 관통하는 하위 텍스트로 삽입된다. 그것들은 다음과 같다 :
1."Ein Gourmet sagte mir: was die Crême der Gesellschaft anlange, so sei ihm der Abschaum der Menschheit lieber." 
"한 미식가가 사회의 핵심보다 지구의 쓰레기를 선호한다고 나에게 말한 적이 있다." 
2. "Wenn Tiere gähnen, haben sie ein menschliches Gesicht." 
"동물이 하품을 하면 사람의 얼굴을 갖게 된다." 
3. "Der Fortschritt macht Portemonnaies aus Menschenhaut." 
"진보는 인간의 피부로 지갑을 만든다." 
4. "In einen hohlen Kopf geht viel Wissen."  
"텅 빈 머리에는 많은 지식이 들어간다." 
5. "Die Technik ist ein Dienstbote, der nebenan so geräuschvoll Ordnung macht, daß die Herrschaft nicht Musik machen kann."   
"기술은 주인이 음악을 만들 수 없을 정도로 옆방에서 시끄러운 명령을 내리는 하인이다." 
6. "Wien hat eine schöne Umgebung, in die Beethoven öfter geflüchtet ist." 
"비엔나는 베토벤이 자주 탈출했던 아름다운 주변 환경을 가지고 있다."

Title: Thomas Oboe Lee: Nonet (2019) - full score
Description:
Nancy Braithwaite has been a champion of my music since 1996 when I wrote a solo clarinet piece (Trinca de Chôros) for her to play at her sister Ann's wedding that year in Vermont. After the wedding Nancy asked me if I would write a new piece for her group the Arto Ensemble. I said yes, and I gave them "Yo Picasso" (1997) for clarinet, viola, cello and piano. Subsequently Nancy requested more works from me … 

Octet in D (2012) 
Clarinet Quintet (2013) 
La Serenissima (2013) 
Alice (2015) 
B.A.C.H. (2018) 

This year she asked me to write a Nonet so that she could feature it with her group the Rietveld Ensemble ﻿in a program with nonets by Bohuslav Martinu and Louis Farrenc. I said yes. 

This work is scored for flute, oboe, clarinet, bassoon, horn, violin, viola, cello and double bass. It is in five movements. 

1. INTRO: Moderato, Allegro @ 0:00
2. Largo, Vivace, TRIO @ 5:10
3. Prestissimo @ 12:15
4. Largo, Adagio @ 14:56
5. Vivace, TRIO @ 20:44

YouYang, flute
Gillian Bobnak, oboe
Aleksis Martin, clarinet
Arekson Sunwood, bassoon
Drew Truskowski, horn
Alison Kim, violin
Chih-Ta Chen, viola
Deok Yong Kim, cello
Diego Martinez, double bass

Jonathan Mott, conductor

Music by Thomas Oboe Lee

© Departed Feathers Music, Inc. - BMI

Title: Viktor Kalabis: Klasický nonet // NeoKlasik orchestr
Description:
Klasický nonet (1956) je dílo Viktora Kalabise (1923-2006), zakladatele Nadace Bohuslava Martinů, který svou badatelskou činností významně přispěl k rozšíření povědomí o životě a díle tohoto klasika české moderní hudby. Kalabisova žena, Zuzana Růžičková pak byla vynikající cembalistkou, jejíž interpretace Martinů Koncertu pro cembalo dílu zajistila čestné místo ve světovém repertoáru pro tento exkluzivní nástroj.

Interpreti:

NeoKlasik orchestr
Václav Dlask /dirigent/

Technické zajištění: Acusticus s.r.o.
Dramaturgický úvod: Sára Jandová
Produkce: Kryštof Tulis, Anežka Januszová, Adéla Rybářová 



Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/nkorchestr
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/neoklasik_o...
GoOut: https://goout.net/cs/neoklasik-orches...


--- eng ---

The Classical Nonet (1956) is a work by Viktor Kalabis (1923-2006), the founder of the Bohuslav Martinů Foundation, where through his research he greatly contributed to the awareness of the life and works of this Czech modern music classic. Kalabis’ wife, Zuzana Růžičková, was an excellent harpsichordist, whose interpretation of Martinů’s Concerto for harpsichord ensured the work an honorable place in repertoire for this exclusive instrument.

Interpreters:

NeoKlasik orchestra
Václav Dlask /conductor/

Technical support: Acusticus s.r.o.
Dramaturgical introduction: Sára Jandová
Production team: Kryštof Tulis, Anežka Januszová, Adéla Rybářová

Title: World video Premiere of the Czerny Nonet - original chamber work in 4 movements for 9 players
Description:
The interview is sponsored by Blou Porselein Guest Farm 
www.blouporselein.com

INTERVIEW:
Artistic Director of the Brooklyn theatre and the Gauteng Philharmonic orchestra is talking about the launch of the world premiere of the Czerny  Nonet.
Launch date Friday 27 August 17:00
via www.artmusic.tv
Programme:
NONET - Carl Czerny
An original chamber work in 4 movements for 9 players.

TROUT QUINTET - D667, Opus 114 - Franz Schubert.

An original chamber work in 4 movements for 5 players.
The program compilation of this chamber music concert's uniqueness lies in the fact that the Czerny Nonet will probably be heard for the first time in SA. The work appeared on the MDG label on a CD in the 90's. To our knowledge, this is the only recording available of this particular work of Czerny. The Nonet is also not to be found on Youtube at all. A SA group that performs it on an international digital platform would make a special contribution and also highlight the high quality of music making in this country.
The Salon Music audience has often been exposed to Carl Czerny's works over the years during the annual Piano Extravaganzas presented by us. The accessibility of Czerny's music became clear from the positive audience reaction of his music.
The popularity of Schubert's masterpiece, the Trout Quintet, is undeniable.
Salon Music has presented it 3 times over the past 26 years, and the turnout for the concerts has always been excellent. However, the performances were never recorded.
We believe that by offering an accessible and exciting program like this,
the interest in chamber music as a genre can be stimulated.
Brooklyn Theatre Salon Ensemble :
Carli d’Alebout - Violin 1
Christopher Evans - Violin 2
Johan Ferreira - Oboe / Cor Anglais
Peter Cartwright - Piano
Esther Watkinson - Bassoon
Jurgens de Lange - Double Bass
Wernd van Staden - Cello
Ken Craig - Viola
Lizet Smith - Clarinet
Options via www.artmusic.tv
1. Purchase a ticket today at R150
(Gives you 3 days/72 hour access)
2. Monthly subscription of R400 which will give you access to a selection of archive concerts and upcoming releases. Watch this in your own time and as many times as you want.
